Description: Miniature wheel-made pottery lamp with a low body, incurved sides, a small rounded nozzle and a large central tube rising above the rim, which is damaged. The raised base is flat below and has string marks below. Covered with a matt red slip. Fine orange fabric with abundant white inclusions and vesicles <0.5mm.
Curator's comments: Shape copies Athenian types (Howland 1958, Type 27C). Late 4th to 3rd century BC parallel from Tell Atrib (Młynarczyk 2012, type TA 1.2). Howland, R.H. 1958. The Athenian Agora, IV, Greek lamps and their survivals, Princeton. Młynarczyk, J. 2012. Tell Atrib 1985-1995. Vol. 3: Terracotta oil lamps. Varsovie : Éditions Neriton.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q537)
Walters 1914 / Catalogue of Greek and Roman Lamps in the British Museum (198)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KC.20) (Phase 1)
